Class SubstitutionEditor

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • SubstitutionEditor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class SubstitutionEditor
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    A window containing a number of RhombDisplays equal to (Point.N() - 1)/2, each of which represents the image under a substitution rule of one of the rhombic prototiles. There is a panel underneath containing a PatchDisplay depicting a generic patch of a tiling arising from this substitution. Modifying the rules causes the patch to change in real time.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • loadSubstitutionEditor

        public static SubstitutionEditor loadSubstitutionEditor(java.lang.String fileName)
        Create a new SubstitutionEditor from a saved state.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file containing the saved state.
        Returns:
        The SubstitutionEditor saved in fileName.

      • standardSeed

        public static java.util.List<SimpleRhomb> standardSeed()
        Output a standard seed for a substitution: a list consisting of a single big rhomb.
        Returns:
        A list containing only one SimpleRhomb, which has angle Point.N()/2 or Point.N()/2 +1.

      • save

        public static void save(SubstitutionEditor editor)
        Static method for producing a pop-up prompt to save the given SubstitutionEditor.
        Parameters:
        editor - The current editor, which the user might wish to save.

      • open

        public static SubstitutionEditor open(SubstitutionEditor editor)
        Static method for producing a pop-up prompt to open a saved SubstitutionEditor.
        Parameters:
        editor - The SubstitutionEditor that called this method.
        Returns:
        The editor that the user chooses to open. If the user cancels, this returns null.
